channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loose manhole (surrounding road cracked), 25th February
item.description:
Opposite Superdrug, the asphalt around a manhole cover is cracked and uneven. The cover is loose and rattles loudly when vehicles pass. The noise is getting worse and the damage is growing daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walworth Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Man hole cover is badly, and in my opinion, dangerously misaligned. Many of the paving slabs in that area are broken, uneven and present a ‘trip hazard‘ including the narrow area between the paving slabs and the grass, 25th February
item.description:
I think it is now a serious hazard to people, especially as it is between the GP surgery and Orpington Pharmacy. The state of the pavements have obviously been deteriorating for some considerable time. Marion Crescent shops are valued by local residents. An inspection of the pavements leading to all the shops, and a plan for urgent repairs, would be very welcome. With thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Marion Crescent, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrowing branch sticks growing from the base of the tree, 25th February
item.description:
Overgrowing branch sticks growing from the base of the tree blocking access around the pavement and zebra crossing on Barry Road at the Goodrich Road junction. Please could it be cut right back to allow pedestrians to cross and walk by safely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Goodrich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car has been parked for months, 25th February
item.description:
This car has been parked here for months with mold growing in it. It’s an eyesore and takes up valuable space on a narrow road. Also with mold spores growing aggressively it appears to be a health hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Grove, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Car stopped and man dumped two bags from boot over fence, 25th February
item.description:
A small dark car reg OY07 VGO came up Farquhar Road from the north, stopped at the side of the road, passenger got out, opened the boot and dumped two stuffed blue rubbish bags over the fence into the wooded area. He closed the boot, got back in and the car drove off, turning right into Jasper Road. I went back to look and there were two stuffed blue bags lying in the woodland.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Farquhar Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
